Round_1: ^You step into the elevator, the soft hum of machinery buzzing faintly beneath your feet.
^It's cold. Sterile. Like the air is waiting for something to happen.
^The doors begin to close. But just before they shut—
chapter_1: ^The door closed, and you managed to take a glance from the corner of your view.
^background look man down to shoulder and stop
^The man's average. Tallish. Pale. Clean suit. Polished shoes.

c-0: ^ You keep your gaze on the floor. The fluorescent lights reflect in the polished steel.
c-1: ^ You meet his eyes. His eyes don’t quite match his smile.
^Something sharp glints in them. Not metal. Something worse.

chapter_2: ^You didn’t answer right away. Something in your throat locks.

c-2: ^  "Only way to go from the top, right?"
g-0: ^He pauses. Like he’s letting the words hang in the air for too long.
^Like he's watching them sink into your skin.

c-5: ^  "Sounds like a setup for a horror movie."

g-1: ^"Or just a moment where everything slips."
^"When you realize you were never alone to begin with."
^You laugh nervously, but it dies in your throat.

chapter_3: ^His reflection in the elevator mirror behind him—it doesn’t move when he does.

c-0: ^ You blink a few more times, heart thudding. Maybe you’re tired.
c-1: ^  You focus on the reflection. It stares back. Eyes too wide.
c-2: ^  You shift away, gripping your bag tighter.

chapter_4: ^A whisper curls in your mind. Soft. Familiar.
^"He’s not real. He’s not. Not this time."
^You shake your head. The whisper is gone.
^The man’s still smiling. But his eyes... they flicker for just a moment.

c-2: ^  "Do you ever feel like someone’s lying to you? Even if they say all the right things?"

chapter_5: ^"I think we'll be seeing more of each other."

g-0: ^He steps out, but just before turning the corner, he glances back.
^You don’t remember pressing the emergency stop, but the elevator halts again.

ROUND_2: ^You step into the elevator once more. The air feels heavier today, the fluorescent lights casting a sickly hue.
^The doors begin to close, but a familiar hand halts their motion.

describe_man_round2: ^His suit is immaculate, but there's a subtle smear on his cuff. His eyes meet yours, and for a fleeting moment, they seem... hollow.
^"Back again. Fate has a peculiar sense of humor, doesn't it?"

g-0: ^"Elevators are like confessionals, don't you think? Small spaces where truths slip out."

elevator_ride_round2: ^The elevator hums as it descends. The floor numbers flicker erratically.
^"Sometimes, I wonder if we're going down at all. Maybe we're just stuck, reliving the same moments."
^You clutch your bag tighter, fingers brushing against something cold and metallic inside.

g-0: ^"Work? I suppose you could call it that. I observe, listen, understand."
^"Tell me, do you ever feel like you're being watched?"
g-1: ^"Is it? Perhaps we're all just mirrors, reflecting each other's truths and lies."

delusion_build_up: ^The elevator's lights flicker, and for a moment, the man's reflection doesn't match his movements.
^A whisper echoes in your mind: "He's not real. End it."
^You shake your head, trying to dispel the voice.
climax_round2: ^The elevator jerks to a halt between floors.
^Your hand moves on its own, reaching into your bag, fingers wrapping around the cold handle of a knife.
^"Sometimes, the only way to see the truth is to cut away the lies."

c-0: ^Without hesitation, you lunge forward, plunging the knife into his chest.
c-1: ^You waver, but the voice in your head screams, and you act.
g-0: ^The man's eyes widen in shock, then fade.
^Suddenly, the elevator doors are pried open.
^"Drop the weapon! Hands where we can see them!"
^As you're restrained, you glance at the man's lifeless body, a pool of blood spreading beneath him.

ROUND_3: ^The elevator dings open again. Same floor. Same hallway. Same flickering light overhead. But this time, your chest feels tight—too tight.
^Something’s wrong. Again. You remember this. You *REMEMBER* this.
^He tilts his head. That same polite nod. But there’s something behind his eyes this time. Or… maybe you’re finally seeing it.
^You can feel your breathing gets uneven.

c-0: ^I stabbed him last time. Didn’t I?
^You clutch your stomach. You can still feel the resistance of the blade… or is that your imagination?
c-1: ^No. That wasn't real. I wouldn't do that.
^You shake your head. No blood. No body. It was just in your mind. You never touched him.
c-2: ^You stare at him, jaw clenched. The memory fuels you, not frightens you.
c-3: ^It’s slipping. Your sense of time. Of truth. Of self. You grip the elevator railing just to ground yourself.

man_speaks: ^“Why do you keep looking at me like that?”
stare_silence: ^You stay silent. He watches you longer than necessary, then shifts his weight, like a predator getting comfortable.
accuse_him: ^“You followed me. In all three rounds. You knew.”
^“I think you’re mistaking me for someone else.”
push_accusation: ^Your hand curls at your side. You *want* to believe he’s lying. Because if he’s not…
confront_paranoia: ^“Why do you keep watching me like that?”
^“I’m… not? You’ve looked on edge since you walked in.”
self_doubt: ^You feel the heat rising to your face. Maybe it really is you. Maybe you’re just seeing things.

floor_counter: ^The elevator ticks past the 4th floor. You’re close. Again.

knife_decision: ^You slide your hand into your pocket. The familiar shape is still there. Cold. Metal.
restraint_path: ^You keep your fists clenched. But you don’t reach for the knife.

prepare_to_stab: ^You lunge. The same blur. The same sound. But this time—he’s ready.

hesitation: ^Your hand shakes. He grabs your wrist.
^“You don’t have to keep doing this.”
stab_scene: ^Blood. Again. But this time, it’s more real. You swear it *hurts* you too.
stab_struggle: ^You drop the knife. He lets go. You both just stare at each other, breathing hard. No words.

choose_not_to_stab: ^You let go of the knife. You look him in the eye. He tilts his head.
elevator_ends: ^The elevator doors open. Same floor. Different you.
END_A_INNOCENT: ^The light flickers red for a split second. Dried blood stains the metal wall behind you.
^—but they hesitate. Almost as if the system itself is… unsure.

describe_man_round4: ^There’s a new scar across his cheek. A thin line. A memory.
^You swallow hard. The air feels thick, like breathing through gauze.

c-0: ^ "Why do I always end up here?"
c-1: ^  "I-I didn’t mean to hurt you last time…"
g-0: ^"Funny, isn’t it? How cycles repeat. Even broken things can loop."
^He says as he points towards the screen.

elevator_ride_round4: ^The elevator descends—only, the numbers are wrong. They tick **up**, then **back down**, then flickers out completely.
^You watch him in the mirrored wall. But something’s wrong—
^His reflection doesn't blink when he does.
^"You know, they told me you weren’t well."

g-0: ^"You didn’t see me clearly… but that wasn’t your fault. Your mind’s a noisy place. Full of smoke and broken glass."

self_doubt_builds: ^Your hand itches. You touch your bag—
^—for a moment, the man’s skin seems to flicker. Pale and clammy. Lips split with blood. Eyes glassy. Dead.
^"What do you see when you look at me?"

c-0: ^  "I don’t know anymore. You’re… not what I thought."
c-1: ^  "You’re a liar. You’ve always been lying."
c-2: ^ "I thought you were dangerous. But now I think I’m wrong."

final_confrontation: ^—but the wall meets you. There’s nowhere left.
^"You let your gut guide you. But guts lie, don’t they?"
^"They twist fear into truth. And truth into knives."
^"But what if you were right the first time?"

c-2: ^"Then… I’ll die knowing I deserved it."

death_scene: ^You collapse to the floor, the world spinning.
^The man kneels beside you, tilting your face.
^"Shhh. You were never supposed to see the whole picture."
^He strokes your hair as your vision dims.
main_ending: ^A newspaper headline flashes across the screen:

s: ^"ELEVATOR KILLER CLAIMS FINAL VICTIM – Mentally Unstable Woman Dies in Final Encounter"**

END_B_JUSTIFIED: ^(The elevator is silent. The air hums with tension. The woman’s hands twitch by her sides.)
^WOMAN: (internal) This is it. The final loop. I don’t know how I know, but... it feels different this time.
^WOMAN: (internal) The way he's standing. How still he is. As if he's waiting.
^(He looks at her—no smirk, no charm, just quiet.)
^MAN: (soft chuckle) And what are you listening for?
^WOMAN: (internal) He’s trying to bait me again. That voice—calm, measured, too careful. Like he’s stepping around landmines.

listening_lies: ^WOMAN: I’ve had four rounds to learn your rhythm. The spaces you leave say more than what you say out loud.
listening_heartbeat: ^WOMAN: I had to learn the hard way. Listening to my thoughts nearly killed me. Now I listen to what’s real.
listening_truth: ^"And that you’re not who I made you out to be."
continue_end: ^Suddenly, you saw something flickered at the edge of your sight.
^You inched your hand towards that thing, just a twitch at a time.
^He’s waiting. Just like before. But this time...
^"You’re looking at me like you know something I don’t."
^No. You're looking at him like you finally know what to believe.
^"Why aren't you answering? What are you- !?"
emergency_brake: ^(Loud alarm. Lights flicker. The elevator shakes to a halt.)
^I chose to believe in something real.
^(Doors are pried open. Blinding flashlights flood in.)
^POLICE OFFICER: Hands where we can see them!
^(The man reaches into his coat—pulling something silver—)
^(He hesitates… then drops the object. It clatters. A *scalpel*.)
^The sight of it gave you chills.
^(breathing hard) It was real… all of it.
^You helped out. Your legs nearly give.
^he stares at her, no longer smiling.
aftermath_awake: ^THERAPIST (V.O.): You did the right thing. You broke the pattern.
^THERAPIST (V.O.): The delusions will try to return. But so will the truth, if you let it.
^You run your hand along the wall as you walk through the hallway, grounding yourself.
^And when you reach the end of the hallway, you saw an elevator, and the emergency exit next to it.

c-0: ^ No, you will never enter that shit ever again in your life time.
c-1: ^You took the emergency exit. There's a lot of staircase.
g-0: ^(Switch to cctv, this time, in the emergency exit. Shows a woman walked in through the door and took the staircase to go downstairs. And this time - a girl follows her. The girl noticed the cctv, did a 'shhh' gesture, and broke the cctv. Story ends.

END_C_MONSTER: ^(The elevator is nearly at the top. The hum is louder now. She’s staring at the man again—trembling, but not from fear.)
^WOMAN: (internal) I know what I saw. I know what he is.
^MAN: You're looking at me like you want to say something.
^WOMAN: (internal) Truth. Heh. They keep asking me what’s real. But none of them were in this elevator.

player_choice_truth: ^"You were going to kill me, weren’t you?"
delusion_kill_me: ^WOMAN: You were going to kill me, weren’t you?
^WOMAN: I don’t need evidence. I remember the blood. I remember the fear.
delusion_smile_lie: ^WOMAN: You always smile when you lie.
^WOMAN: That’s what they all say. But I see past it. I see you.
delusion_saw_you: ^WOMAN: I saw you. In every version.
^WOMAN: No. You were real. You always were. The knife. The blood. Your voice in the dark.
continue_delusion: ^(The hum of the elevator is rising in pitch. Her hand slides into her bag.)
^WOMAN: (internal) They’ll never understand. They’ll think I’m mad again. That I need help.
^WOMAN: But I don’t. I just need to end this.
^(She pulls the knife out slowly. Her reflection in the metal gleams.)
^SFX: [Sickening crunch. Blood splatters the elevator wall.]
^POLICE OFFICER: DROP THE KNIFE! DROP IT NOW!
^(But she just stands there. Covered in blood. Smiling.)
aftermath_delusion: ^(Black screen. Soft ambient noise—muffled voices, flickering lights.)
^NARRATOR: Days later. A padded room. A woman sits facing a mirror that doesn’t reflect her.
^THERAPIST (V.O.): We found no one. No victim. Only you. Covered in blood.
^WOMAN: (internal) They’re lying. Just like he did. Just like everyone does.
^(The mirror flickers. For just a second, the man’s face appears in the reflection—smiling.)

END_D_DENIAL: ^(The elevator ride is slow. The lights flicker again. Her breathing is shallow, but steady.)
^WOMAN: (internal) Maybe I was wrong. Maybe I imagined it. He hasn’t done anything.
^(The man stands at the far end, leaning against the rail. Calm. Watching her.)

denial_choice_approach: ^"I just want to get out of here."
^"This is just in my head, right?"
denial_escape: ^WOMAN: I just want to get out of here.
^WOMAN: No more talking. Just let this be over.
denial_doubt: ^WOMAN: This is just in my head, right?
^MAN: Then pretend it is. Pretend everything’s fine.
denial_silent: ^(She doesn't speak. Just clutches her bag tighter.)
^WOMAN: (internal) If I don’t acknowledge him, he can’t hurt me. Right?
continue_denial: ^(The elevator dings. Floor 14. Still going. The air is thick. She shifts her weight.)
^WOMAN: (internal) One more minute. That’s all. Just get through one more minute.
^MAN: You ever wonder what happens when we hit the top?
^(Suddenly, the elevator *jerks violently*. Lights snap off. Emergency red light glows.)
^SFX: [Mechanical groaning. A rising shriek in the metal.]
^(She turns — he’s now standing *right beside her*.)
^(He smiles — mouth stretching impossibly wide. His eyes *bleed black*.)
^(She tries to scream. He places a finger on her lips.)
^MAN: Shhh. This is your silence. You asked for it.
^(He plunges something into her chest. Not a knife — just *darkness*. It spreads like ink.)
^SFX: [Heartbeat slows. The elevator doors open to nothing — a void.]
aftermath_denial: ^(Black. Then faint static. A flickering video feed.)
^NARRATOR (V.O.): Police investigation report. Elevator 17. No signs of struggle. No victim. No assailant.
^DISPATCH (V.O.): Last known footage shows a woman standing alone. Smiling. Talking to herself.
^(The screen flickers to *CCTV footage* — she’s speaking, gesturing… to no one.)
^WOMAN (CCTV): (murmuring) I just want to go home.
^NARRATOR (V.O.): No trace of her ever found.
^(Final flash: A red-lit elevator. Empty… except for a *bloody handprint* on the mirror.)
